summary: CIA officer (1947-1967) - Berlin Tunnel operations, ZR/RIFLE assassination program chief, Cuban operations, reveals CIA's willingness to conduct assassinations and covert violence at operational level
key_facts: Berlin Tunnel (1954-1956): Operation to tap Soviet communications in East Berlin
ZR/RIFLE program: CIA assassination program chief under Richard Bissell
Executive Action: Euphemism for assassination capability, Harvey developed operational protocols
Cuban operations: Task Force W leader for anti-Castro operations during Cuban Missile Crisis
Relationship with organized crime: Recruited mafia for Castro assassination attempts
Johnny Roselli: Chicago mob figure Harvey worked with for Cuban operations
Abrasive personality: Known for heavy drinking, carrying weapons, confrontational style
JFK tensions: Harvey's Cuban operations conflicted with Kennedy administration policy
Richard Helms: CIA superior who protected Harvey despite conflicts
Dismissed from operations: Sent to Rome station after Cuban Missile Crisis conflicts
Death 1976: Never publicly disclosed full extent of assassination operations
intelligence_connections: FBI (1940-1947): Harvey's intelligence career began with FBI
CIA (1947-1967): Operations officer specializing in technical operations and covert action
Berlin Tunnel: Major signals intelligence operation against Soviets
ZR/RIFLE: Assassination program targeting foreign leaders
Task Force W: Anti-Castro operations, largest CIA station
Organized crime: Harvey recruited mafia figures for Castro assassination plots
Johnny Roselli: Mob liaison for CIA assassination attempts
Richard Bissell: CIA Deputy Director who created ZR/RIFLE, Harvey's superior
Richard Helms: CIA officer who protected Harvey's career
Cuban exiles: Harvey coordinated operations with anti-Castro groups
Church Committee (1975): Investigated Harvey's role in assassination plots posthumously
concealment_mechanisms: Compartmentation: Assassination operations highly classified, need-to-know only
Euphemisms: 'Executive Action' and 'ZR/RIFLE' obscured assassination purposes
Mafia cutout: Using organized crime provided deniability for CIA
Destroyed records: Many assassination program files destroyed before investigations
Limited testimony: Harvey never fully disclosed operations publicly
Church Committee revelations: Only partial disclosure after Harvey's death (1976)
Plausible deniability: Operational structure shielded directors from assassination knowledge
power_structure: Mid-level CIA operational officer who executed assassination program under Bissell's direction - ZR/RIFLE shows CIA institutionalized assassination capability, mafia recruitment demonstrates intelligence-organized crime nexus, Task Force W operations show scale of anti-Castro operations, Harvey's protection by Helms despite conflicts shows CIA shields operators
strategic_significance: Harvey represents CIA's operational assassination capability - ZR/RIFLE institutionalized targeted killings as policy tool, mafia recruitment shows CIA willingness to partner with criminals, Church Committee revelations exposed only after Harvey's death suggesting ongoing sensitivity, operational tier (Harvey) executed what policy tier (Dulles/Bissell) authorized with deniability
